sentences.literal: Side loaded fragrant chai, thus nourish nose also;
Front has inlaid yoke, thus nourish eyes also;

sentences.chinese: 和鸞之聲，步中武象，驟中韶濩，所以養耳也；
sentences.literal: Harmonious luan sound, walking matches Wu image, galloping matches Shao Hu, thus nourish ears also;
Dragon banner nine streamers, thus nourish trustworthiness also;

sentences.chinese: 寢兕持虎，鮫韅彌龍，所以養威也。
sentences.literal: Reclining rhinoceros grasping tiger, shark boots dragon-embroidered, thus nourish awe also.

sentences.chinese: 故大路之馬，必信至教順，然後乘之，所以養安也。
sentences.literal: Therefore great carriage's horses, must trustworthy arrive trained obedient, then ride them, thus nourish security also.

sentences.chinese: 孰知夫［士］出死要節之所以養生也。
sentences.literal: Who knows that shi exiting death demanding integrity reason for nourishing life.

sentences.chinese: 孰知夫輕費用之所以養財也，孰知夫恭敬辭讓之所以養安也，孰知夫禮義文理之所以養情也。
sentences.literal: Who knows that light expenditure reason for nourishing wealth, who knows that respectful yielding reason for nourishing security, who knows that rites righteousness pattern principle reason for nourishing feelings.

sentences.chinese: 人茍生之為見，若者必死；
sentences.literal: Person if birth's as seen, such ones must die;
If profit's as seen, such ones must harm;
Indolent lazy as security, such ones must danger;
Emotions victory as security, such ones must extinction.

sentences.chinese: 故聖人一之於禮義，則兩得之矣；
sentences.literal: Therefore sages unify at rites righteousness, then both obtain them;

sentences.chinese: 一之於情性，則兩失之矣。
sentences.literal: Unify at emotions nature, then both lose them.

sentences.chinese: 故儒者將使人兩得之者也，墨者將使人兩失之者也。
sentences.literal: Therefore Confucian scholars will make people both obtain them, Mohist scholars will make people both lose them.
